intro: Schoenoplectiella trapezoidea, commonly known as the narrowleaf bulrush, is a flowering plant native to wetland environments in North America. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, commonly referred to as the sedge family. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads that are typically wind-pollinated. It thrives in shallow water or moist soil, often forming dense stands in marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
